name: Hilton Garden Inn Arlington/Shirlington

reviews.text: Very clean and the service is excellent!
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.text: The breakfast is delicious! Went for a conference two years in a row.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Turned Nightmare

reviews.text: This hotel is located in a very nice & beautiful area with plenty of shops & eateries within short walking distance. It must be a very pet friendly area, we saw lots of dogs -all breeds. Some places of business even provided water for pets outside establishments. Parking is free, a definite plus in this area, but it's across the street from hotel (about block's walk) & you are only allowed to park on 4th floor of parking garage, would recommend walking w/someone to & from at night esp. if woman, however we felt it was very safe environment. Check-in is at 3:00pm, we arrived between 5:30-6:00pm & had to wait about 20 min. for our 2 Q room.."wasn't cleaned yet" per Musa at front desk. Little disappointed there were no cookies (as we had read about) at front desk esp. since having to wait, didn't bother asking check-in person for any b/c he was working alone & very busy, others also waiting on rooms and we were more interested in getting to room. The lobby area was very nice, clean & had pretty decor, while waiting we decided to look around at other areas in hotel such as dining, conference room, pool, & bath rooms all very nice and clean. The bathroom for women near dining area well stocked w/feminine products in a basket for the taking, this is something that I haven't found in other hotels. They have a pantry near front desk w/snacks that you can purchase & it can be added to your room charges, also a grocery store right across the street from hotel. The indoor pool was small. After getting in our room it looked very nice except dust could be seen in different areas (tables, TV, bed headboards, etc.) to have been "just cleaned". Room had a microwave & frig which was nice since we like to keep cold water, soda's & other cold snacks on hand & even "left-over's" from eating out, also had large screen TV w/good channel service - a plus for those who don't sleep well away from home & want something other than books. The bed linen was very crisp & clean, however the bed did not sleep well due to needing new mattress. It felt like the mattress had a deep crease right down the middle from head to toe, this caused us to roll right into that area, we were constantly climbing "uphill" out of crease on each side trying to find a flat surface...not fun :( if had to do over would have & should have asked for another room, just hate to seem like nagging). Shuttle service was provided free to Pentagon City Metro station (? airport also) for us but expect to provide tips, you can tell by the way driver's leave money showing that they are counting on them, however after pointing that out must say they did show great experience w/driving abilities & were very friendly. Do not expect fast service w/shuttle it ran behind a lot on days we were there & even longer wait time in evenings, if needing to catch a flight would def. recommend leaving extra early. Room service was great in morning/daytime but could have been better in evening hours. We needed clean linen for bathing one night, (we never use room service in any hotel b/c we don't want anyone in our room when we are out & normally exchange our dirty/clean linen from housekeeper before leaving or going out for the day, on this morning we asked housekeeper on our floor for our clean linen but she told us she was out so we decided we could get it that night) it took a considerable amount of time to get it brought up, feel this too was because of decreased evening help which made it understandable. Room had large desk/lamp & great newer type desk chair w/free Wi-Fi & a lot of receptacle's for charging all devices (phone, compt., games, etc.) this (receptacle's) too was more than we usually find in other hotels. The room had a large window which allowed for lots of natural light during day & black out shades for night. The Bathroom was nice but not a lot of places for linen...linen was stored on wall rack inside shower & could get wet if not removed when showering. The lighting was ok for putting on makeup but like most hotels could have been better.The water pressure/shower head was alright & we had all the hot water we needed. The toilet flushed a little sluggish which did cause some concern at times but did fine during stay. The sliding glass closet doors doubled as full length mirrors. Hair dryer hung on bathroom door in pouch & was much better than the usual ones you find attached to the walls in a lot of hotels. The iron & board were nice & worked well also. The room was spacious enough for a large cushion chair & ottoman to relax in. NOW for the HUGE BUT on morning of our check-out date we needed to step out of room to get a couple of washclothes, upon trying to unlock door the dead bolt wouldn't budge in the slightest even tho we could feel it wasn't "catching inside" metal part of door handle...as someone who suffers from panic attacks (as well as my sister who was on the trip) & hasn't experienced one in a very long time this was certainly the thing to throw me into one...I called front desk to inform of our situation & asked for a maintenance man to be sent up at once to "get us out of room"...housekeeper on other side of door also tried to get door opened but couldn't as she heard us yelling for help...after few minutes (which seemed like hours) called front desk again...finally after waiting for several minutes a man came up & worked on door managing to get it opened & acknowledged it was broken. I realize that for some this may seem silly but ppl that don't suffer panic/anxiety attacks can't imagine what the terror is like...& to think if this would have happened during a fire..it's situations like this that cause the many tragic "freak accidents" we all read/hear about...needless to say upon check out we discussed how serious this could have been with the two front desk men agreeing & apologizing for the delay as they informed us that it took a few minutes b/c they don't have a maintenance man on property & "when something breaks down/tears up we call someone to come out & fix"...so thankful they didn't tell us this while still locked inside of room. I was given credit back for one night's stay but would not have been put through the trama for all the money spent on the trip!! All of the staff were very friendly & if I am ever in the area again I would probably stay at this hotel but will certainly make sure all things are working properly and will try out bed before bedtime!
reviews.title: I could give it an 11 out of 10...

reviews.text: This is a wonderful property. Everything the other writers have mentioned, I say ditto- it's clean, in a beautiful area with good restaurants, and a wonderful staff. We are "locals"-- moving from one house to another--this has been our home for five days while we wait to get into a new home. I could not express my thanks for the helpful staff who has made this as easy for us as possible. We have only the greatest regard for the staff and management. Great job, everyone!
reviews.title: Excellent Location for Families

reviews.text: This hotel is located in a great neighborhood that is perfect for families. Restaurants are plentiful and there is a grocery store directly across the street. Parking is FREE in a convenient garage directly across a small street.
reviews.title: Excellent, from a Discriminating Traveler...
GREAT HOTEL!
reviews.text: Amazing staff. mazing breakfast. Kick butt location. CLEAN.

reviews.title: Good Choice
reviews.text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

The Shirlington neighborhood around the hotel has lots of restaraunts and is quite busy on weekend nights. The hotel does have it's own restaraunt but I saw very few people eat dinner there. We did enjoy the breakfast buffet they offered.
reviews.title: Outstanding value - great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free parking is a definite perk. Note it is across the street and you must park on the 4th floor. It adds a few minutes to your coming and going, but can't complain given it's included. There's a great supermarket that sells beer and wine as well on the ground floor of the parking garage.
reviews.title: We hit the jackpot

reviews.text: The pool is the smallest I've ever seen at a hotel. There's a whirlpool as well.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here, to be close to our brother who lives in Alexandria. We were only here two nights, wish it had been more. We had a room with two queen beds. Very clean room, very comfortable beds. We were on the 6th floor. It was quiet. We found a roof top deck area, but since it was very warm we didn't spend much time out there. We saw the pool and hot tub. The pool was long and narrow, unlike any pool I'd ever seen. We hadn't brought suits, so I can't say what the water was like. It looked clean. We didn't eat at the hotel, we chose Poets and Busboys which is right next door, great place. What we really enjoyed about the hotel was the shuttle. We called and they picked us up at the airport within 15 minutes. And then they even brought us to our brothers place, because it was within 5 miles of the hotel. The shuttle is FREE, we tipped the driver each time, but this was great since we chose not to rent a car! The area is great to walk around, there is a grocery store, and several restaurants and the Capital Brewing Company too. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Not too far outside of DC. Great little neighborhood with lots of restaurants and shops. I was comfortable walking around the streets at 9pm by myself. Grocery store across the street. Pool is NOT big. Only about 6 feet wide. Wasn't a fan of the firmness adjustable beds. But the hotel was very clean. No complaints in that end. That is the main thing I look for in a hotel is to see if it is clean.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great little neighborhood and free parking.

reviews.text: Outstanding hotel, perfect location,beds comfy I did not want to leave.Free parking across the street alongside a market that has anything you need. Everything seems new so I would assume this was just built or would seem to be.
reviews.title: "Clean as a whistle"

reviews.text: Stayed here for a niece's wedding, the entire family and friends on both sides stayed here and found this a great place for all of the activities, great resturants near by .The beds were comfortable and was a great place for the groups to meet in between activities ,shopping and the rehersal dinner and events. Would recommend...
reviews.title: great location,rooms are good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is hard to beat. Convenient to DC and Arlington attractions, nice restaurants and shops within walking distance, free parking, free transportation to the Metro. That alone would get a very good rating. The rooms are nice and comfortable. Not huge but not tiny. The staff is what makes this an excellent hotel. During our stay a huge storm hit the DC area a knocked out power to the hotel. The staff was very helpful in keeping us informed of our options and helped make what could have been a very ugly situation bearable. I would not hesitate staying here again. If you're able to fly in to Reagan you can get by without a car. Between the Metro and the hotel shuttle you can see all of the DC sites without a car.
reviews.title: Great location, great property, great staff

reviews.text: I usually stay here for my frequent trips to DC. They provide a shuttle to the Metro and Shirlington has one of my favorite restaurants. It is close to shopping and entertainment I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on business to DC.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had high hopes for this hotel we were coming to stay at for a wedding. The location is amazing. That being said when we arrived to the hotel it was downhill from there. We had reservations for a King room, when we got to our room it was 2 double beds, they said they "overbooked" the hotel and could not give us our reservation (meanwhile they were not nice about, and I was just asking why we didn't have our original arrangements). When we got checked in we got upstairs to our room and neither key worked, the receptionist didnt even bother to give us active keys, we got 2 blanks. The lock on the bathroom door was broken, there were no curtains or drapes to block out the morning sun, or even better the view of a brick wall 4 feet from our window. The rooms were clean, but looked as if they were missing furniture, big gaps in the room.
reviews.title: Great Location, Poor Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Leaving the hotel we noticed all the fire doors were shut, so I ran into the night manager to ask what happened, and the man did not speak english, he literally signed what happened, which was someone smoked in the room. Ok - so we go downstairs to get a cab to the wedding, and they say it will take 40 minutes. Or just walk outside and flag one down (seemed to be more effective).
reviews.title: Our "Rolling Thunder" hotel

reviews.text: Like I said the location is unbeatable, however I wish their staff would be a little nicer, and the hotel more accomodating.
reviews.title: Very good accomodations

reviews.text: My wife & I stayed at this hotel for Rolling Thunder 2012 in DC. We picked this hotel because it was close to where the motorcycle ride events were occuring. The hotel had a reserved section for mortocycle parking in the parking garage across the street, no charge. The hotel is in a village setting with many restaurants, shops and businesses within a few blocks. Our room was large, comfortable and well equipped with wi-fi and big screen tv. This is a first class hotel and it shows.
reviews.title: Great Locaton, Free Parking

description: The Hilton Garden Inn Arlington Shirlington Virginia hotel is conveniently located just off I-395, minutes from The Pentagon, Washington, D.C. and only 10 minutes from Reagan National Airport. Situated in trendy Shirlington Village - one block from the US Patent and Trademark Office and within walking distance from Shirlington Station.
